We need cryptopredators for cryptokitties!

Note that I'm not suggesting betting on cryptokitties or that they are a good investment. I'm saying something stronger: as ridiculous an investment as the kitties may seem, they are still a better SoV than a coin you can't transact.
Terrible. Also, anyone paying more than $40 for a cryptokitty should go out, adopt a real cat, and give it a good life.

No, the cryptokitty market isn't that deep so that strategy would not scale. I would not store value as BTC -- the devs have left the Science station and are now off the rails, toasting champagne to high fees. ETH and BCH can be legitimate SoVs with increasing adoption.
Speaking of cryptokitties: do they have a lifetime? Genetic diseases? Or are we going to be inundated with an exponentially increasing number of cryptokitties?

Paradoxically, cryptokitties are a better SoV than BTC, because kitties are art, and artwork actually has an inherent value. I'll pay a few cents for a pretty, custom cat pic, and so will most others. A coin that you cannot transact in because the fees are high captures no value.
